CatDescriptText: Mr. Donald Erwin, 152 New Arlington Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?" answer reads: "I don't think so because they received a raise a short time ago. This is the second one in a year and they should have made the increase enough the first time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Donald Erwin, wearing eyeglasses, moustache, light colored checker patterned zippered jacket, and dark cap, standing in front of light colored concrete wall with stone wainscot, left store window displaying home accessories
